edu.soton.fpl.game

Interface FantasyCompetitor

  • All Superinterfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public interface FantasyCompetitor
extends java.lang.Runnable
    Interface for an automated competitor in a fantasy competition When the season first starts initialise() is called. Then, before each gameweek initialiseSquadSelection() is called. run() is then called, during which the competitor should select the next squad. The next squad should be set inside the FantasyCompetitorPerformance object that was provided in initialise(). If the competitor runs out of time (if there is a time limit) stopSquadSelection() will be called and the competitor is given a small amount of time to 'wind down' and make their final selection.
    Author:
    Tim Matthews

      • initialise

        void initialise(FootballWorld oWorld,
              FantasySeason oSeason,
              FantasyCompetitorPerformance oPerformance,
              FantasySharedSamplers oTools,
              int iLastGameweek)
        Initialise the competitor at the beginning of the competition
        Parameters:
        oWorld - A reference to the football world the competitor is involved in
        oSeason - The season the competitor is taking part in
        oPerformance - The competitor's performance so far
        oTools - Samplers and assessors shared by all competitors
        iLastGameweek - The index of the last gameweek the competitor was involved in

      • initialiseSquadSelection

        void initialiseSquadSelection(ViewingContext oView)
        Perform any optional setup prior to selecting the squad
        Parameters:
        oView -

      • run

        void run()
        Select a squad. This method is called in a separate thread from other method calls. The squad should be set using FantasyCompetitorPerformance.setSquad() using the FantasyCompetitorPerformance object provided in the initialise() method.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • stopSquadSelection

        void stopSquadSelection()
        Called when the thread that run() is executing in will be shortly stopped. The competitor should make his final selection in this method, and stop execution of the run() method to avoid it being killed.
